section.title: Element: Function
section.simpara: The Function element encapsulates user-defined functions and operators. It consists of a body of expressions and bindings to functions.

formalpara.title: Function content
formalpara.para:
The Function body contains zero or more of the following:
Expression FuncExpr Condition Guard . They may appear in any order and in any number.

formalpara.title: Function attributes
formalpara.para:
The name attribute is the same as in the Expression element, containing one or more names separate by spaces to indicate the names that are given to this function. The class attribute gives the type of the function, which is one of the following:
ambivalent monadic dyadic . These correspond directly to the three classes of Fn stimuli that we have in our Function Specification. We also have the comment attribute which should appear if there is a comment on the same line as the first line of the definition of a function that has no expression or other body element on it. The alloca attribute indicates the number of slots needed to allocate space for the local scope of the function. The depth attribute indicates the depth of the function's definition, determining the number of environments it may reference.
